basics.name: Shuai Victor Zhou
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an undergrad student at UC Berkeley studying Computer Science and Mathematics. I come from a background of competitive math, physics, and engineering. In my free time, I enjoy hiking, learning languages, creating videos, watching shows, and playing poker.

work.summary: Developed skills in NumPy, Matplotlib, tkinter, multithreading, and more to build an application that offloads data from our mercury sensors and processes the data for the customers; ran lab tests to better understand the product while also testing the accuracy of our sensors, and worked closely with our clients working in ASGM as well as other fields/big companies to improve the UI/UX of the GUI. Spearheaded the customer discovery for our new product by conducting research in the mercury market on our competitors as well as potential clients, interviewing companies/parties interested in the mercury field (from research to environmental services alike), and investigating the rise in related products in foreign countries.
Began education at Berkeley, majoring in Computer Science and Mathematics.

Worked as a teaching assistant for teaching elementary and middle school students competition-level mathematics. Acted as teacher for teaching Science Bowl topics to elementary and middle school students and held mock competitions.
Conducted research on graph traversal heuristics; developed skills in MATLAB, research, and presentation.

Founder and lecturer of my high school's Physics Club. Provided students with a place to solidify their foundation physics skills, as well as meet like-minded peers with an interest in physics, learn higher level content, and prepare for national-level physics competitions. Organized and coordinated volunteering at regional middle schools to foster a passion for physics within younger students.
